result.execSummary:
All charges against Zahida Nureen Leech in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zahida Nureen Leech is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zahida Nureen Leech

04:39 PM   CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson,ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jon Elton Stanek on case 21CT241; DF ATTY: Tyler Kongslien for cases 21CM580 and 22M19, DF:  Zahida N. Leech appeared. Includes 21CT241, 21CM580 and 22CM19. 
RE: 21CM580: Court amends to a county ordinance of #52 - Disorderly Conduct.  Def pleads NC to Cty Ordinance #52; NC/GNC and orders court costs of $114.50.  
Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 21CT241. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 21CT241. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CT241 and 2022CM19. Sentencing recommendations. Court orders in Count 1 in 21CT241: S/W 2 years probations with conditions:
- 10 days in St. Croix County jail. Can serve over 2 consecutive weekends, upon approval of the SCSO. Def to reporty on/before July 8th, 2022. Huber is authorized. 1 day jail credit. 
- Absolute sobriety 
- AODA and complete all follow through. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Participate in any recommended assessment and complete follow through. 
- 12 month License Revocation
- 12 month Ignition Interlock
- $1429 Fine, Inclusive of costs; payable through clerk of court. Add to current payment plan. 
- $27 Blood draw cost (SCSO); payable through clerk of court. Add to current payment plan. 



Sign up for probation by Noon on May 12, 2022

Def advised of right to appeal.

08:55 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY:  Tyler T Kongslien (21CM580) and Jon Stanek (21CT241), DF:  Zahida Nureen Leech appeared by video means. Pre-trial/scheduling conference on January 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

_X_ SIGNATURE BOND: 
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $750
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

$250 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least TWO times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:43 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY: Travis Satorius and Kaitlin Dippolito for today     Zahida Nureen Leech appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant has Atty Stanek as court-appointed atty in Branch 3 file. Bond argument; sidebar. Bond ordered- overpayment of cash to be returned to payor. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court judicially transfers to Branch 1 and sets PSC with Branch 1. Adjourned at 1:50 PM.  gll  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
